quiz_questions.question_text: There are many variable types of data we collect in order to get a 360 degree profile of a visitor that adapts to changing data in real time.  What are they? Select 5 correct answers
presented_options: validation data; used for specific keywords and external identifiers
Behavioral data; what the visitor does, clicks, etc. while on digital owned property
Fundamental data: defined by the expressions that a visitor used on Facebook
Temporal data; when and how often a site is visited
Environmental data; device type, operating system, time zone, etc.
Referral data; where the visitor is coming from and what they clicked to arrive
Third-party and offline data; CRM, loyalty Programs, call center data, etc.
correct_options: Behavioral data; what the visitor does, clicks, etc. while on digital owned property
Temporal data; when and how often a site is visited
Environmental data; device type, operating system, time zone, etc.
Referral data; where the visitor is coming from and what they clicked to arrive
Third-party and offline data; CRM, loyalty Programs, call center data, etc.
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Adobe Target - test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which Capability of Adobe Target enables marketers to test multiple page elements, in more permutations than they can do manually.
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Adobe Target - test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which Capabilty of Adobe Target enables organizations to quickly compare two versions of content and experiences to determine the most effective content for distinct visitor Audiences?
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Adobe Target - test out

quiz_questions.question_text: When individual data isn't available to determine a visitor's actual preference, what feature of the recommendations and cross-selling capability ensures that the visitor still receives content that may be relevant to them? Select correct answer
presented_options: Broad recommendations based on visitor segments
Indirect recommendations to all audience members
correct_options: Broad recommendations based on visitor segments
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Target Recommendations and Cross Selling? Test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following familiar trusted, and proven recommendation strategies can be implemented using the recommendations and cross-selling capatiblity of Adobe Target Premium to promote relevant content and products?  Select three correct answers
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Target Recommendations and Cross Selling? Test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the effectiveness of the decision engine of the automated personalization capability of Adobe Target?  Select the correct answer
presented_options: It works best on anonymous visitors for which no personal data is available
It is self-learning, so the longer it is active, the more accurate it becomes
It draws all its data from Adobe Analytics, so it is 100% accurate all the time
It is particularly effective on Secure pages, such as those used by financial services companies
correct_options: It is self-learning, so the longer it is active, the more accurate it becomes
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Target Automated Personalization ? Test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes Cross-channel optimization?  Select the correct answer
presented_options: It enables marketers to collate data from mulitple sources to create various audience segments
It allows marketers to target messages or app experiences based on the GPS location of the user
It enables mobile marketers to evaluate app experiences using A/B and multivariate testing
It allows marketers to collect data and target experiences across multiple devices and channels
correct_options: It allows marketers to collect data and target experiences across multiple devices and channels

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes Geolocation Targeting?  Select correct answer

It enables marketersto collate data from mulitple sources to create various audience segments
It enables mobile marketers to evaluate app experiences using A/B and multivariate testing

correct_options: It allows marketers to target messages or app experiences based on the GPS location of the user

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes features of the mobile app optimization and personalization capabilities of Adobe Target?  Select three correct answers

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes Experience Targeting?  Select the Correct Answer
presented_options: It allows marketers to collect app and web data across mulitple devices and channels
It allows marketers to target specific content, offers, or user experiences to a particular audience Segment
It enables mobile marketers to evaluate app experiences using A/B and multivariate testing
It enables marketers to collate data from multiple sources to create various audience segments
correct_options: It allows marketers to target specific content, offers, or user experiences to a particular audience Segment
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Target Mobile App Optimization and Personalization.  Test out

quiz_questions.question_text: Which of the following options are benefits of the mobile app optimization and personalization capabilities of Adobe Target?
presented_options: Mareketers can test and target critical interactions throughout the user journey
Comprized data can be compared with that of rival companies
Customers who are satisifed with their app experience are more willing to try competitor offers
Customers can be delivered an efficient app experience that is tailored to them
Personalized app experiences are likely to decrease positive app store ratings
correct_options: Mareketers can test and target critical interactions throughout the user journey
Customers can be delivered an efficient app experience that is tailored to them
quiz_questions.question_source: What is Target Mobile App Optimization and Personalization.  Test out

quiz_questions.question_text: When using AT.js or mbox.js, what occurs for a given user if the default timeout value is reached?  Select the correct answer
presented_options: Target will continue to make the mbox request and will display the response once it becomes available
Target will exclude that visitor from making any mbox calls for the next 30 minutes and will serve only default content during that timeframe
Target will display default content for that mbox and will continue to make subsequent mbox calls to deliver a personalized experience
Target will not show any content for the mbox call
correct_options: Target will exclude that visitor from making any mbox calls for the next 30 minutes and will serve only default content during that timeframe

Download AT.JS and include a reference to AT.jS in the script tag within the page Footer
Download AT.JS and include a reference to AT.jS in the script tag within the page Body section
No need to reference on your site as Target does this for you

quiz_questions.question_text: While debugging an mbox request, where would you go to see a list of name value pairs that were sent to Target as part of the mbox call?

mBox call was unable to reach Adobe Target

quiz_questions.question_text: ____  let you automatically output Target-specific information (campaign details, user profile information, geo information, and so forth) to use in debugging or integrating with 3rd-party systems (such as Clicktale).   ____ let you choose which variables to leverage and then enable them to be sent as part of an mbox response. In order to do so, you simply enable a variable using the switch and the variable will be sent with mbox responses, which can be validated in network calls.    Fill in the blank
quiz_questions.question_source: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: The estimated lift is calculated using the following formula:  Select the correct answer
presented_options: (<winning experience RPV> - <control experience RPV<)*<total number of visitors in the activity>
<winning experience RPV> * <total number of visitors in the activity>
<winning experience RPV> / <total number of visitors in the activity>
<control experience RPV> * <total number of visitors in the activity>
correct_options: (<winning experience RPV> - <control experience RPV<)*<total number of visitors in the activity>
quiz_questions.question_source: Account Settings Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: What are some reasons the Esimated Lift in Revenue is not being shown on the activities page, even though it has been enabled?
presented_options: There were not enough visitors to calculate the value
You did not provide an estimated value metric in the goals and settings page when setting up the activity
The best performing experience is the control experience
You are running Target Standard and this feature requires Target Premium
Estimated Lift is only availabe fo winning Product Recommendations
correct_options: There were not enough visitors to calculate the value
You did not provide an estimated value metric in the goals and settings page when setting up the activity
The best performing experience is the control experience
quiz_questions.question_source: Account Settings Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: If you turn off the use of element IDs for generating CSS Selectors to locate items on the page, target will then default to finding elements by using?
quiz_questions.question_source: Account Settings Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: In order to display an image of your experience on the flow diagram of the activity, you should enable which feature under the Visual Experience Composer Settings?
quiz_questions.question_source: Account Settings Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: In order to preview how your activity will look on different size mobile devices within the Visual Experience Composer, you should add devices within this section of the Account Preferences.
quiz_questions.question_source: Account Settings Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: When using Experience Targeting, if a visitor has been shown mulitple experiences for an activity and coverts.  The conversion is attributed to ?
presented_options: The expereince leading to a sale
quiz_questions.question_source: Experience Targeting Tests: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: When using Experience Targeting, A Visitor is counted for ?
presented_options: The experience where the visitor spent the most time
quiz_questions.question_source: Experience Targeting Tests: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: When using Experience Targeting, if a visitor qualifies for more than one experience within an activity, what is the evaluation criteria used to determine which experience they are shown?
quiz_questions.question_source: Experience Targeting Tests: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: If you setup an MVT activity with 3 variations of the marquee image, 2 variations of the header text, and 4 variations of a CTA button.  How many distinct offer combinations will be setup for the actiivty?
quiz_questions.question_source: Creating a multivariate test - CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: One advantage of using this type of test instead of an A/B test is that the this test will show which element most contributes to a campains success.  What is this type of test?
quiz_questions.question_source: Creating a multivariate test - CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When executing an MVT Test, test duration will be impacted by:
quiz_questions.question_source: Creating a multivariate test - CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: What two reports are available when you analyze the results of you multivariate Test?
quiz_questions.question_source: Creating a multivariate test - CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: Where does in Adobe Target can you see the Collision Report?
presented_options: Within each activity on Collision Tab
Within each activity on the Reporting tab
correct_options: Within each activity on Collision Tab
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical Foundations OD) Collision Detection:CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: An Activity collision by definition Is when ?
presented_options: When two or more activities have been configured for the same page URL
When two or more activities have been configured for the same audience
When two or more of the same type of activities have been configured for the same page URL
When two or more activities have been configured for the same date and time
correct_options: When two or more activities have been configured for the same page URL
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical Foundations OD) Collision Detection:CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When Adobe Target delivers content to the page, the activities are rendered in what order?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical Foundations OD) Collision Detection:CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: The Collision Report shows potential collsions as opposed to actual collisions.  Ture or False
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical Foundations OD) Collision Detection:CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When using Auto-Allocate for A/B Tests, existing visitors will always see the leading experience even if it is different than their assigned experience. True or False
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Auto-Allocate tests : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When you want to optimize your activity from the beginning and identify the winning experiences as quickly as possible, you should select which type of activity?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Auto-Allocate tests : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When you want to characterize/rank the performance of all experiences before optimizing your site, you should select which type of activity?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Auto-Allocate tests : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When you want to have the following: Optimize combinations of content, not pre=defined experiences.Complex optimization algorithms that build predictions based on individual profiles.Discover responsive visitor segments.  You should select which type of activity?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Auto-Allocate tests : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: If the legacy priority settings of Low, Medium, and High are not enough when asisgning the priority settings, enabling Fine-grained priorites allow you to set priorties on a scale from ?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Activity Settings : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: If you create a 4-way Auto Allocate test, for which all 4 Experiences are identical. Once sufficient traffic has been reached so the algorithm has enough data so it can perform allocation what would you expect to see as a result?
presented_options: Traffic remains equally distrubuted across the 4 options
One Experience will receive 100% of the traffic
One Experience will receive 70% of the traffic and 30% will be randomly distributed to the other three
correct_options: Traffic remains equally distrubuted across the 4 options
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Auto-Allocate tests : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Using Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: _____ help you determine how different types of visitors respond to the same content
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Using Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: What options are available when combining rules and parameters for audience definitions?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Creating Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Creating Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: When creating an audience within Target, if you want to target new or returning visitors, which Rule option would you need to use
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Creating Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_text: When creating an audience within Target, if you want to target visitors based on what sites there were coming from when landing on your site, which Rule Option would you need to use?
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations(OD) Creating Audiences: Custom

quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Activity Settings : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Activity Metrics : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: When setting up an activty and selecting a goal metric of Engagement, if you wanted to assign different engagement weights to different pages to show that some pages have a higher value in relation to the test.  What actions should you take?
presented_options: Select Custom Scoring as Secondary metric
Pass in custom Scoring value to the mBox as a parameter
Select Site Pages as Secondary metric
Assign Custom weights within Goal Metric Section
correct_options: Select Custom Scoring as Secondary metric
Pass in custom Scoring value to the mBox as a parameter
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Activity Metrics : CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: ______ is a code snippet defined in Target that uses server-side JavaScript to capture visitor attribute
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Profile Scripts: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: ______ capture visitor attributes by passing attributes values up thorugh mBox calls in the code implementation of Target(mBox.js or AT.js)
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Profile Scripts: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: What three user encounter settings are available within Activity Metrics?
presented_options: Increment Count & Keep User in Activity
Increment Count & Release User & Allow Reentry
Increment Count & Release User & Bar Reentry
Increment Count & Exclude User from Activity
correct_options: Increment Count & Keep User in Activity
Increment Count & Release User & Allow Reentry
Increment Count & Release User & Bar Reentry
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Advanced Metrics: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: If you want to use the Advanced Activity Metrics settings for an Activity, you must select what as the Reporting Source?
presented_options: Either Adobe Target or Adobe Analytics
The exact location within the experience

quiz_questions.question_text: Adobe Target provides the following Qaulity Assurance Options:
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Quality Assurance and Activation: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: This Target Quality Assurance Option offers the following Benefits: Content renders precisely as it will in the final activityEasy to Qualify  - can force an active entryGreat for Browser Compatability TestsEasy to share with team members without Target Login
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Quality Assurance and Activation: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: This Target Quality Assurance Option offers the following Benefits: Content renders precisely as it will in the final activityTargeting conditions can be testedSuccess metrics(reporting) can be testedAllows testing in productionAllows testing of delivery timing from target
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Quality Assurance and Activation: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: This Target Quality Assurance Option offers the following Benefits: Content renders precisely as it will in the final,published activity(assuming test and prod environments)Targeting conditions can be testedSuccess metrics(reporting) can be testedAllows testing in productionCan avoid Data Pollution
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Technical foundations (OD) Quality Assurance and Activation: CUSTOM

quiz_questions.question_text: Which activity type should be used to deliver a temporary promotion banner to all site visitors that clicked through an email campaign?
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A Target Business Practitioner (BP) needs to create an activity. The Target BP chooses AdobeTarget as a reporting source instead of Adobe Analytics.What is one reason that the Target BP chooses Adobe Target?
presented_options: The BP wants to create multiple custom metrics using the VEC.
Adobe Analytics causes a 24-hour delay in results.
An unusually high number of visitors must be tracked in the activity.
Analysis needs to include trends over time.
correct_options: The BP wants to create multiple custom metrics using the VEC.
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A Target Business Practitioner needs to make sure an activity is free of any collisions with any previously made activities.How should the Target Business Practitioner confirm that this is true?
presented_options: Launch the activity and rely on Target to block any colliding activities.
Review the Status, Priority, and Audience of every activity on the same URL to make sure there is no undesired overlap.
Confirm that the activity has a unique name that is NOT duplicated or closely resembled elsewhere.
Set the priority level to "high" on the new activity.
correct_options: Review the Status, Priority, and Audience of every activity on the same URL to make sure there is no undesired overlap.
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A stakeholder asks the Target Business Practitioner (BP) to create an activity that tests the addition of a pop-up message after a visitor adds an item to their cart.Which of the following would allow the BP to correctly target this audience?
presented_options: Add a custom mbox parameter for users with cart additions and target this audience to users with that parameter
Create an Analytics segment published to the Marketing Cloud for visitors with cart additions and target this audience to that segment
Select Visitor Profile > "Cart Additions" in audience creation
Target the activity to the cart URL
correct_options: Add a custom mbox parameter for users with cart additions and target this audience to users with that parameter
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A particular search engine marketing campaign is driving users to a landing page URL with tracking codes appended. The tracking codes must be present in the URL for the search team's tracking, which occurs in a separate tool. A Target Business Practitioner (BP) created an activity experience that redirects incoming users from that default landing page to a new page. After the activity has been running for 1 week, the search team notes that the tracking codes are NOT included in the URL when users arrive at the new page. What should the BP do to fix this?
presented_options: Create a profile script that will store the tracking codes for each user
Change the activity to exclude users without a tracking code
Include the new page in the activity URL targeting
Check the "Include Current Query Parameters" checkbox on the experience
correct_options: Check the "Include Current Query Parameters" checkbox on the experience
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A Target Business Practitioner (BP) reviews the ongoing results of an activity with four experiences. The BP notes that there are about 400-500 visitors for each experience, but the clickthrough metric shows 0 for two of the experiences. Which step should the BP take first?
presented_options: Verify the metric is set up properly in the activity
Remove any activity experiences with data discrepancies
Stop the test and report on all current findings
correct_options: Verify the metric is set up properly in the activity
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: The conversion rate in the results data for an A/B Test activity is much lower than expected. A Target Business Practitioner (BP) must validate the ongoing activity and ensure proper performance. What should the BP do first?
presented_options: Monitor data of all live activities
Re-examine the activity setup and metrics
correct_options: Re-examine the activity setup and metrics
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: A Target Business Practitioner (BP) is reviewing test results after an activity has ended. The test showed a 5% increase in revenue per visitor. The sample size was reached, which was set to prove up to a 2% difference in order rate.The following effects were observed:• 5% increase in revenue per visitor (RPV)• 0.5% increase in orders per visitor• 3% increase in average order value• 3.5% increase in average order size• 0.5% decrease in page views• 0.8% increase in product viewsA stakeholder asks the BP to annualize the impact on revenue projected through the next year to present as program ROI.How should the BP proceed?
presented_options: Inform the stakeholder that the result would NOT be trustworthy because the test was sized to prove differences in order rate.
Project annual revenue attributed to the audience in the test over the next year and multiply by the lift observed.
Project annual revenue attributed to the audience in the test over the next year and multiply by the lift observed.
Inform the stakeholder that the test would need to run four times as long to prove differences in order rate.
correct_options: Inform the stakeholder that the result would NOT be trustworthy because the test was sized to prove differences in order rate.
quiz_questions.question_source: Business Practitioner Sample Exam Test

quiz_questions.question_text: When viewing the Location Contribution Report, which table shows conversion rate, lift and confidence for each offer?  Select the correct ansewr
quiz_questions.question_source: Target Activity : test OUT
